projects.title: Dockerized Web Application with CI/CD
projects.description: Deploy a simple web application using Docker and set up automated CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions
projects.shortDescription: Docker deployment with automated CI/CD pipeline
projects.fullDescription: Build and containerize a simple web application (Node.js/Python Flask), create a Dockerfile with best practices, set up Docker Compose for multi-container setup (app + database), and implement a CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions that automatically builds and pushes Docker images. This project teaches containerization fundamentals, Docker best practices, and basic CI/CD automation - essential skills for entry-level DevOps roles.

implementationSteps.title: Create a Simple Web Application
implementationSteps.description: Build a basic web app using Node.js Express or Python Flask with a few API endpoints (e.g., /health, /api/data). Add a simple frontend (HTML/CSS/JS) that calls these APIs. Set up a PostgreSQL or MongoDB database for data storage. Test locally to ensure everything works before containerization.

implementationSteps.title: Write Dockerfile & Build Image
implementationSteps.description: Create a Dockerfile using best practices: multi-stage build, non-root user, minimal base image (alpine). Copy application code, install dependencies, expose port, and define CMD. Build the Docker image locally: 'docker build -t myapp:v1 .' Test the container: 'docker run -p 3000:3000 myapp:v1' and verify it works.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Docker Compose
implementationSteps.description: Create docker-compose.yml with services for your app and database. Define volumes for data persistence, networks for service communication, and environment variables. Use 'docker-compose up' to start both services together. Test the full stack locally and ensure the app connects to the database successfully.

implementationSteps.title: Create GitHub Actions CI/CD Pipeline
implementationSteps.description: Create .github/workflows/ci-cd.yml in your repo. Set up workflow triggers (on push to main). Add jobs: (1) Build Docker image, (2) Run tests (optional), (3) Push to Docker Hub or GitHub Container Registry. Use secrets for registry credentials. Test the pipeline by pushing code changes.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy & Document
implementationSteps.description: Deploy your containerized app to a free hosting service (Render, Railway, or AWS Free Tier EC2). Write comprehensive README.md with architecture diagram, setup instructions, and screenshots. Document Docker commands, environment variables, and deployment steps. Add this project to your portfolio with live demo link.

projects.title: AWS Infrastructure with Terraform
projects.description: Build production-ready AWS infrastructure using Terraform - VPC, EC2, RDS, and load balancer with proper networking and security
projects.shortDescription: Infrastructure as Code with Terraform on AWS
projects.fullDescription: Design and deploy a complete AWS infrastructure using Terraform IaC principles. Create a custom VPC with public/private subnets, deploy EC2 instances with auto-scaling, set up RDS database in private subnet, configure Application Load Balancer, and implement security groups with least privilege access. This project demonstrates cloud infrastructure design, IaC best practices, and AWS service integration - critical skills for DevOps engineers.

implementationSteps.title: Plan Infrastructure Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Design a 3-tier architecture: (1) Load Balancer in public subnet, (2) EC2 web servers in public/private subnets, (3) RDS database in private subnet. Draw architecture diagram showing VPC, subnets, route tables, internet gateway, NAT gateway, and security groups. Document the infrastructure requirements and AWS services needed.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Terraform Project Structure
implementationSteps.description: Initialize Terraform project with proper structure: main.tf, variables.tf, outputs.tf, provider.tf. Configure AWS provider with credentials (use environment variables or AWS CLI profile). Create reusable modules for VPC, EC2, RDS, and security groups. Set up remote state with S3 backend (optional but recommended).

implementationSteps.title: Create VPC & Networking Infrastructure
implementationSteps.description: Write Terraform code to create VPC with CIDR block. Define public and private subnets across 2 availability zones. Create Internet Gateway for public subnet connectivity. Set up NAT Gateway for private subnet internet access. Configure route tables and associate with subnets. Add VPC flow logs for monitoring.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy EC2 Instances & Load Balancer
implementationSteps.description: Create EC2 launch template with user data script to install web server. Set up Auto Scaling Group with min/max instances. Configure Application Load Balancer with target groups. Define security groups: ALB (allow 80/443), EC2 (allow traffic from ALB), RDS (allow from EC2). Deploy RDS MySQL/PostgreSQL instance in private subnet.

implementationSteps.title: Test, Document & Destroy
implementationSteps.description: Run 'terraform plan' to preview changes, then 'terraform apply' to create infrastructure. Test the setup: access ALB DNS, verify EC2 instances are healthy, check RDS connectivity. Document all Terraform variables and outputs. Write README with architecture diagram, setup instructions, and cost breakdown. Run 'terraform destroy' to clean up and avoid AWS charges.

projects.title: Kubernetes Microservices with Monitoring
projects.description: Deploy multi-tier microservices application to Kubernetes with Helm, set up Prometheus/Grafana monitoring, and implement GitOps with ArgoCD
projects.shortDescription: Kubernetes deployment with monitoring and GitOps
projects.fullDescription: Build a complete Kubernetes-based deployment for a microservices application. Containerize multiple services (frontend, backend API, database), create Kubernetes manifests (Deployments, Services, Ingress, ConfigMaps, Secrets), package with Helm charts, set up Prometheus and Grafana for monitoring and alerting, and implement GitOps workflow with ArgoCD for automated deployments. This advanced project demonstrates container orchestration, observability, and modern DevOps practices used in production environments.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Local Kubernetes Cluster
implementationSteps.description: Install and configure Minikube or Kind for local Kubernetes cluster. Set up kubectl and verify cluster access. Create namespace for your application. Alternatively, use a cloud Kubernetes service (AWS EKS, GCP GKE, or Azure AKS free tier). Install Helm package manager for Kubernetes. Familiarize yourself with basic kubectl commands.

implementationSteps.title: Containerize Microservices & Create K8s Manifests
implementationSteps.description: Build 3 microservices: frontend (React/Vue), backend API (Node.js/Python), and database (PostgreSQL/MongoDB). Create Dockerfiles for each service. Write Kubernetes manifests: Deployments (with resource limits), Services (ClusterIP for internal, LoadBalancer/NodePort for external), ConfigMaps (for configs), Secrets (for sensitive data). Deploy to cluster using kubectl apply.

implementationSteps.title: Package Application with Helm
implementationSteps.description: Create Helm chart structure: Chart.yaml, values.yaml, templates/ directory. Templatize all Kubernetes manifests using Helm syntax. Define configurable values: image tags, replicas, resource limits, environment variables. Test Helm chart with 'helm install' and 'helm upgrade'. Create separate values files for dev/staging/prod environments.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Prometheus & Grafana Monitoring
implementationSteps.description: Install Prometheus Operator using Helm chart. Configure ServiceMonitors to scrape metrics from your services. Install Grafana and connect to Prometheus data source. Create dashboards showing: CPU/memory usage, request rates, error rates, pod health. Set up alerting rules in Prometheus for high CPU, pod crashes, or service downtime. Configure Alertmanager for notifications.

implementationSteps.title: Implement GitOps with ArgoCD
implementationSteps.description: Install ArgoCD in your Kubernetes cluster. Connect ArgoCD to your Git repository containing Helm charts. Create ArgoCD Application resource pointing to your charts. Configure auto-sync for automatic deployments on Git commits. Test the GitOps workflow: change image tag in Git, watch ArgoCD automatically deploy the update. Set up RBAC and access controls for ArgoCD UI.

implementationSteps.title: Add Ingress, Testing & Documentation
implementationSteps.description: Install Nginx Ingress Controller. Create Ingress resource to expose services externally with custom domain (use nip.io for local testing). Add readiness and liveness probes to all deployments. Perform chaos testing: kill pods and verify auto-recovery. Document the complete architecture with diagrams, deployment steps, monitoring setup, and GitOps workflow. Record a demo video showing the entire system in action.
